headline: Venus Aerospace Announces Strategic Investment by Lockheed Martin to Accelerate Breakthrough Innovations in Next-Generation Propulsion
summary: Venus Aerospace, the startup leader in next-generation rocket engine propulsion, today announced a strategic investment in the company by Lockheed Martin through their investment arm, Lockheed Martin Ventures. The investment follows Venus's historic May 2025 high-thrust test flight of its rotating detonation rocket engine (RDRE), an event described by the Houston Chronicle as a "world first" that represents the first generational leap in rocket engine technology since the Apollo Program. headline: LMT Q3 Deep Dive: Backlog Growth and Demand Signals Offset Margin Concerns
summary: Security and Aerospace company Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 8.8% year on year to $18.61 billion. The company’s outlook for the full year was close to analysts’ estimates with revenue guided to $74.5 billion at the midpoint. Its GAAP profit of $6.95 per share was 9.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Lockheed Martin (LMT): Net Margin Declines to 5.7% as Profitability Narrative Faces Pressure
summary: Lockheed Martin (LMT) saw its earnings decline by 4.6% per year on average over the last five years, culminating in a negative earnings growth rate in the most recent year. Net profit margin also pulled back to 5.7%, down from 9.4% a year ago. This highlights the challenge of maintaining profitability in the current environment. While future projections call for annual earnings growth of 14.2% and revenue growth of 3.1%, both remain below broader US market rates and may temper investor...
